text: Natalius (c. 199 – c. 200) was a figure in early church history who is sometimes considered to be the first antipope of Rome. The only information about Natalius is a quote from an unnamed earlier writer by Eusebius,Historia Ecclesiastica, V, 28 telling of a 3rd-century priest who accepted the bishopric of the Adoptionists, a heretical group in Rome. Natalius soon repented and tearfully begged Pope Zephyrinus to receive him into communion.Dictionary of Christian Biography and Literature: Zephyrinus == See also == * List of papal elections * Papal conclave * Papal selection before 1059 == Notes == Category:Year of birth unknown Category:Year of death unknown Category:Antipopes Category:2nd-century Romans Category:2nd-century antipopes Category:Year of birth uncertain
title: Antipope Natalius
